data_table.description: Osteoprotegerin, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3

variable.name: plate
variable.description: ELISA plate id that sample was run on
variable.comment: Character variable PLATE variable indicates date the plate war run as well as the initials of the tech who ran it, which means it is also the date and tech that ran the sample as well. If there were more than 1 plate run on a specific day by the same tech, it is delineated by an A or B. Blank = Field not filled in. Non-blank = Field filled in.

variable.name: res2
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: cvper
variable.description: % CV for those run in duplicate
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: opg
variable.comment: For flag = 1 or 2, OPG is the same as RES1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. For flag = 3 OPG is the same as RES1 because all phantoms were only run in singleton. For flag = 4, OPG is the mean of RES1 and RES2 because all controls were done in duplicate. 0.843 - 26.903 FOR FLAG = 1; 1.772 - 14.279 FOR FLAG = 2; 2.040 - 10.189 FOR FLAG = 3; 1.724 - 2.894 FOR FLAG = 4

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID numbers in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate
